approveTrade(address,bytes).details: only perpetual contract can call this function

params.orderSender: is the one who submit tradeData.
params.tradeData: contains orders, signatures and match info.

params.primaryAmount: is the amount of primary asset you want to deposit.
params.secondaryAmount: is the amount of secondary asset you want to deposit.
params.to: is the account you want to deposit to.

params.isInternal: Only internal credit transfers will be made, and ERC20 transfers will not happen.
params.param: call "to" with param if not null.

params.isInternal: Only internal credit transfers will be made, and ERC20 transfers will not happen.
params.param: call "to" with param if not null.
params.primaryAmount: is the amount of primary asset you want to withdraw.
params.secondaryAmount: is the amount of secondary asset you want to

getLiquidationPrice(address,address).details: This function is for directional use. The margin of error is typically within 10 wei.

returns.liquidationPrice: equals 0 if there is no liquidation price.

params.perp: the address of perpetual contract market

returns.exposure: open position value of the trader across all markets
returns.initialMargin: Funds required to open a position.
returns.maintenanceMargin: Funds needed to keep a position open.
returns.netValue: net value of trader including credit amount

isAllSafe(address[]).details: This function is more gas effective than isSafe, by caching mark prices.

openPosition(address).details: Only perpetual contract can call this function when someone's position is opened.

realizePnl(address,int256).details: Only perpetual contract can call this function when someone's position is closed.

requestLiquidation(address,address,addre.details: Only perpetual contract can call this function. liqtor is short for liquidator, liqed is short for liquidated trader.

params.liquidatedTrader: is the one who is being liquidated.
params.liquidator: is the one who will take over positions.
params.requestPaperAmount: is the size that the liquidator wants to take. Positive if the position is long, negative if the position is short.

params.primaryAmount: is the amount of primary asset you want to withdraw.
params.secondaryAmount: is the amount of secondary asset you want to withdraw.

approveTrade(address,bytes).notice: Help perpetual contract parse tradeData and return the balance changes of each trader.

deposit(uint256,uint256,address).notice: Deposit fund to get credit for trading

getAllRegisteredPerps().notice: Return all registered perpetual contract market.

getCreditOf(address).notice: Return the credit details of the trader. You cannot use credit as net value or net margin of a trader. The net value of positions would also be included.

getFundingRate(address).notice: Get funding rate of a perpetual market. Funding rate is a 1e18 based decimal.

getLiquidationCost(address,address,int25.notice: a view version of requestLiquidation, liquidators can use this function to check how much you have to pay in advance.

getLiquidationPrice(address,address).notice: Get liquidation price of a position

getMarkPrice(address).notice: Return mark price of a perpetual market. price is a 1e18 based decimal.

getOrderFilledAmount(bytes32).notice: Get filled paper amount of an order to avoid double matching.

getPositions(address).notice: Get all open positions of the trader.

getTraderRisk(address).notice: Get the risk profile data of a trader.

handleBadDebt(address).notice: Transfer all bad debt to insurance account, including primary and secondary balances.

isAllSafe(address[]).notice: Check if a list of traders are safe.

isOrderSenderValid(address).notice: check if order sender is valid

isSafe(address).notice: Check if the trader's margin is enough (>= maintenance margin). If so, the trader is "safe". The trader's positions under all markets will be liquidated if he is not safe.

openPosition(address).notice: Register the trader's position into dealer.

realizePnl(address,int256).notice: Accrual realized pnl and remove the trader's position from dealer.

requestLiquidation(address,address,addre.notice: Calculate the paper and credit change of liquidator and liquidated trader.

requestWithdraw(address,uint256,uint256).notice: Submit withdrawal request, which can be executed after the timelock. The main purpose of this function is to avoid the failure of counterparty caused by withdrawal.

setOperator(address,bool).notice: Register operator. The operator can sign order on your behalf.

updateFundingRate(address[],int256[]).notice: Update multiple funding rate at once. Can only be called by funding rate keeper.

documentation.text:
@notice Check if the trader's margin is enough (>= maintenance margin).
 If so, the trader is "safe".
 The trader's positions under all markets will be liquidated if he is
 not safe.

@notice Get funding rate of a perpetual market.
 Funding rate is a 1e18 based decimal.

@notice Update multiple funding rate at once.
 Can only be called by funding rate keeper.

@notice Transfer all bad debt to insurance account,
 including primary and secondary balances.

@notice Register operator.
 The operator can sign order on your behalf.
@param perp the address of perpetual contract market
@notice Return all registered perpetual contract market.

@notice Return mark price of a perpetual market.
 price is a 1e18 based decimal.
@notice Get all open positions of the trader.

@notice a view version of requestLiquidation, liquidators can use
 this function to check how much you have to pay in advance.

@notice Get filled paper amount of an order to avoid double matching.
 @return filledAmount includes paper amount
@notice check if order sender is valid
@notice check if operator is valid
